Posted By: Lexew (5/3/2009 6:39:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: chandra naalar is a pretty good planeswalker, and elspeth doesnt even phase this one. her +1 ability can help to keep opponet planeswalkers at bay while you bombard them with creatures. dealing damage to creatures can help, but if its enough damage to take out a big baddy, you might as well have just used her last ability, which is my favorite. Chandra's last ability kills, literally. it will completely destroy opponent planeswalkers, and leave their whole feild bare. then you can unleash your full power against your opponent and destroy them. If you can't win after using chandra's last ability, either your opponent has a ton of life, or your doing something way wrong. Super good in any red deck, just make sure to use her last ability at least once if u get her out.

Posted By: Elven_planeswalker (5/22/2009 5:09:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Chandra, one of the most hyped of the first 'walker set. And she *is* very nice.  
  
Before O-Bolas got his new card, she had the only ability that could increase her loyalty and hold down other 'walkers from attaining an ultimate out of the first generation 'walkers (barring some baby makings by Garruk).  
  
Her second ability is only *really* good because of her nice beefy beginning loyalty. Most creatures will die from 4 or less damage . . . and her starting loyalty allows her to be a 5cc 6 damage burn spell at any creature. This is really good . . . but after one activation of it, it hurts her far too much to allow her not to die the very next turn more often than not.  
  
Her last ability... is a little overkill... 10 damage, to each creature, and their god-'walker (the player, for you nonVorthos)!? By the time that happens, in most red decks, your opponent ***will*** be dead.  
  
A killer beginning this new card type, and a wonderful successor to Jaya. And lik... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Chandra, one of the most hyped of the first 'walker set. And she is very nice.

Before O-Bolas got his new card, she had the only ability that could increase her loyalty and hold down other 'walkers from attaining an ultimate out of the first generation 'walkers (barring some baby makings by Garruk).

Her second ability is only really good because of her nice beefy beginning loyalty. Most creatures will die from 4 or less damage . . . and her starting loyalty allows her to be a 5cc 6 damage burn spell at any creature. This is really good . . . but after one activation of it, it hurts her far too much to allow her not to die the very next turn more often than not.

Her last ability... is a little overkill... 10 damage, to each creature, and their god-'walker (the player, for you nonVorthos)!? By the time that happens, in most red decks, your opponent will be dead.

A killer beginning this new card type, and a wonderful successor to Jaya. And lik... (see all)
